Issues.Title: Correctly set the targeting pack and runtime framework version
Issues.Body:
When runtime builds stable, the runtime framework version and targeting pack versions will no longer be the same.
Microsoft.NETCore.App's version is non-shipping, and so should not be used for the RuntimeFrameworkVersion.
The targeting package version should be set based on the ref pack version, since it won't rev with the runtime.

Issues.Body:
Fixes #3598


## Proposed changes
- Added condition that focus should not be removed from tool strip control when it is located in Print Preview Dialog 

## Customer Impact

- No

## Regression? 

- No

- Minimal

- NET Core 5.0.100-rc.1.20411.10

Issues.Title: An error appeared after reference the Winformscontrollib project in the winforms core project
Issues.Body:
## Version info
Latest .NET SDK 5.0.100-rc.1-20426.12 + Dev16 16.8.0 Preview 2.0

## More info
1. The issue also can reproduce on Windows Forms(Winforms) Class Library project.
2. The UserControl also can reproduce on ToolBox window for UserCOntrol1 designer, have a same issue to track it:[1840](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms-designer/issues/1840)

## Minimal Reproduction Scenario
1. Create a winformcontorllib project.(Only can created using CLI https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/3608).
2. Add some controls on the UserControl1 designer, then build the project.
3. Add a winforms core project in the same solution.
4. Reference the winformcontorllib project in the winforms core project.
5. Build the winforms core project.
6. Changed the Target Framework from net5.0-windows to net5.0 of winformcontorllib project.
7. Reference the winformcontorllib project in the winforms core project again, then build the winforms core project.

## Expected Behavior
After steps5: build the winforms project successfully.
![GitHubIssueFramework](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38325459/91415430-9d419400-e880-11ea-8bae-56a9c5272c6f.gif)

## Current Behavior
[ContorlLib.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/5134999/ContorlLib.zip)
After steps5: An error appeared. however the UserControl1 can drag & drop successfully.
Note: The error seems related the change from: https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/3631/files#diff-6cb9871f2e55c4449d99393fcefb1c3c.
![GitHubCoreIssue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38325459/91415443-a2064800-e880-11ea-82ba-8bb602ce52dd.gif)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "An error appeared after reference the Winformscontrollib project in the winforms core project" (#3790)

Issues.Title: The right border and lower border of Button is incorrect when setting button's FlatStyle as Flat or Popup.
Issues.Body:
<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->

* .NET Core Version: 
5.0.100-rc.1.20426.12

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
No

* More info:
 1. This is a regression issue.
 2. It cannot reproduce on .NET core 3.1 & .NET 5.0 Preview8.

**Problem description:**
When set button's FlatStyle as Flat or Popup, the right border line of button is not overlap.(lower border also exist this issue)
![net5](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/62929087/91409466-053fac80-e878-11ea-9dd7-8c66cc70196f.gif)

**Expected behavior:**
The right border and lower border of button should display as following video.
![core31](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/62929087/91409457-0244bc00-e878-11ea-9149-1bffa5bac076.gif)

**Minimal repro:**  [TestApp.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/5134713/TestApp.zip)
1. Create a new winforms .NET core project and target to .NET 5.0.
2. Add a Button to the form designer.
3. Set the FlatStyle of Button as Flat.
4. Build and run the project.
5. Observe the right border and lower border of button.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The right border and lower border of Button is incorrect when setting button's FlatStyle as Flat or Popup." (#3789)

Issues.Title: Adding dotnet3.1/dotnet-eng packages sources
Issues.Body:
In order to remove dependencies on sleet from release branches,
it is neccessary to preemptively add these sources so that mehanisms
will be able to restore these packages.

Sleet must be removed because of it's strong dependency on spcific
nuget.packaging versions, which are not stable between 3.0 and 3.1
causing method load exceptions.

Issues.Title: Add unimplemented types for deprecated UI controls
Issues.Body:
<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

I am migrating a large Winforms .NET Framework 4.7.1 solution to .NET 5.0 (preview 8). My biggest pain are the deprecated UI Controls like ContextMenu and related types like 'MenuMerge'. Not because of my own code, I don't use them anymore. But we use quite some 3rd party libraries who still have references to these deprecated types. Libraries that are not so much in development anymore.

For example a library supports both ContextMenu and ContextMenuStrip. I don't use ContextMenu, so this is always a null reference, but because the type ContextMenu cannot be loaded from System.Windows.Forms.dll using .NET5 all these 3rd party libraries are broken in runtime.

**Describe the solution you'd like and alternatives you've considered**

If instead of completely removing these deprecated types, it was replaced with "empty" placeholder types, maybe throwing a 'DeprecatedException' when a method of it is called, just so old libraries can load it in runtime, then my solution conversion to .NET5 would be so much easier.

**Will this feature affect UI controls?**

No?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add unimplemented types for deprecated UI controls" (#3783)

Issues.Title: LinkLabel cut off
Issues.Body:
* .NET Version: 
3.1.301

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
Yes. .NET Framework 2.0-4.8

**Environment:**
- VS2019 16.6.3
- Windows Server 2008 R2 x64 Chinese lang

**Problem description:**

LinkLabel width not enough.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12094247/91275592-f6db8d00-e7b2-11ea-9614-829d32c61a5a.png)

**Expected behavior:**

like last one.

**Minimal repro:**

1. create a winform project
2. drag a `CheckBox` on `Form1`
3. add a new `Form` (auto name to `Form2`)
4. drag two `LinkLabel`s and a `Label` on `Form2`, make sure the z-order is(top to bottom): `linkLabel1`, `linkLabel2`, `label1`
5. set `linkLabel1` and `linkLabel2` font to `Arial, 10.5pt`
6. register the `Load` event for `Form2`, write codes:
    ```c#
    linkLabel2.Text = string.Empty;
    linkLabel1.Text = "<未选择>";
    linkLabel2.Text = "<未选择>";
    ```
7. modify `Main` method contents to follow codes in `program.cs` :
    ```c#
    Application.EnableVisualStyles();
    Application.SetCompatibleTextRenderingDefault(false);
    
    new Form1().ShowDialog();
    Application.Run(new Form2());
    ```
8. F5, close `Form1`, now you can see the `linkLabel1` width is not enough

**Demo.zip**
[LinkLabelWidthBugDemo.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/5128326/LinkLabelWidthBugDemo.zip)

**Reference:**
- [https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/problem/1159811/linklabel-width-not-enough-in-particular-cases.html](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/problem/1159811/linklabel-width-not-enough-in-particular-cases.html)
- [https://stackoverflow.com/questions/63554856/linklabel-width-not-enough-in-particular-cases](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/63554856/linklabel-width-not-enough-in-particular-cases)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "LinkLabel cut off" (#3780)

Issues.Title: Cannot get the expected result when set "\r\n" to RichTextBox.Text property
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 
5.0.0-rc.1.20425.1

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
No

**More info:**

1. This issue does not occur in .NET Framework.
2. This issue does not occur in .NET Core 3.1 and .NET 5.0 Preview 8. It's a regression issue in 5.0.0-rc.1.20425.1.  
3. It maybe caused by this PR: [3726](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/3726)

**Problem description:**

Cannot get the expected result in RichTextBox.Text property when included the "\r\n" in it.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45864985/91247890-efea5580-e785-11ea-8b59-6b046eb4d8a1.png)

**Expected behavior:**
Should get the below value from RichTextBox.Text property. Like it works in .NET Framework and previous version of .NET Core SDK.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45864985/91247920-02fd2580-e786-11ea-866b-142eae4ae63f.png)

**Minimal repro:**

1. Launch the attached project in VS.
2. Run it and observe the value for richTextBox1.Text in debugging. 
[Issue1-TestApp.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/5127204/Issue1-TestApp.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Cannot get the expected result when set "\r\n" to RichTextBox.Text property" (#3778)

Issues.Title: Fix getting stock objects (#3774)
Issues.Body:
Stock objects have a different define in metafile records. Correct values for API usage.

Add rectangle validation to the EMF validator and add regression tests for button and the Interop definitions.

Ported from https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/3774 / https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/commit/6f4b818cdc3fd3a76492cfd1fb6947a3482635c9

## Customer Impact

- Flat style buttons and other controls that use a null/hollow brush don't render correctly.

## Regression? 

- Yes

## Risk

- Low

Issues.Title: Fix getting stock objects
Issues.Body:
Stock objects have a different define in metafile records. Correct values for API usage.

Add rectangle validation to the EMF validator and add regression tests for button and the Interop definitions.

Fixes #3770

## Customer Impact

- Flat style buttons and other controls that use a null/hollow brush don't render correctly.

## Regression? 

- Yes

## Risk

- Low

Issues.Title: The BackColor & MouseOverBackColor property of Button doesn't work
Issues.Body:
<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->

* .NET Core Version: 
.Net SDK 6.0.100-alpha.1.20421.6

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
No

* More info: 
This is a regression issue, it cannot reproduce on .Net SDK 5.0.100-preview.8.20417.9

**Problem description:**
The BackColor of Button doesn't work when Button's FlatStyle is Flat or Popup .
The MouseOverBackColor of Button doesn't work when Button's FlatStyle is Flat.
![Actual](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/62929087/91145995-db0bb480-e6e8-11ea-9c36-6fbf1b51a5f2.gif)

**Expected behavior:**
After run the project, the Button's BackColor should be YellowGreen;
When mouse over on the button, Button's BackColor should be Firebrick.
![Expected](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/62929087/91146004-df37d200-e6e8-11ea-90f4-17199a8001d6.gif)

**Minimal repro:**  [DemoApp.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/5122064/DemoApp.zip)
1. Create a new winforms .NET core project and target to .NET 5.0.
2. Add a Button to the form designer.
3. Add the following code to the structure method of Form1.
    _button1.FlatStyle = FlatStyle.Flat;
    button1.BackColor = Color.YellowGreen;
    button1.FlatAppearance.MouseOverBackColor = Color.Firebrick;_
4. Build and run the project.
5. Observe the BackColor of Button, then mouse over on the button and observe the BackColor of Button.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "The BackColor & MouseOverBackColor property of Button doesn't work" (#3770)
